title: 79/279. Further modalities of the Third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries

 Resolution adopted by the General Assembly 
on 11 April 2025 
 
 
[without reference to a Main Committee (A/79/L.71)] 
 
 
 79/279. Further modalities of the Third United Nations Conference on 
Landlocked Developing Countries 
 
 
 
The General Assembly, 
 
Recalling its resolutions 76/217 of 17 December 2021, 77/246 of 30 December 
2022, 77/329 of 25 August 2023 and 78/315 of 10 July 2024 on the convening of the 
Third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries,  
 
Recalling also its decision 79/537 A of 6 December 2024, by which it decided 
that the Conference should be postponed to a later date and held at a venue to be 
decided,  
 
Recalling further its resolution 79/233 of 24 December 2024, by which it 
adopted the Programme of Action for Landlocked Developing Countries for the 
Decade 2024–2034, contained in the annex to the resolution,  
 
1. 
Welcomes and accepts with appreciation the generous offer of the 
Government of Turkmenistan to host the Third United Nations Conference on 
Landlocked Developing Countries, and decides that the Conference will be held in 
Awaza for a duration of four days, from 5 to 8 August 2025, at the highest possible 
level, including Heads of State and Government, on the theme “Driving progress 
through partnerships”; 
 
2. 
Decides, upon the convening of the Conference, to rename the Programme 
of Action for Landlocked Developing Countries for the Decade 2024–2034 1  the 
“Awaza Programme of Action for Landlocked Developing Countries for the Decade 
2024–2034”;

paragraphs.1: Welcomes and accepts with appreciation the generous offer of the Government of Turkmenistan to host the Third United Nations Conference on Landlocked Developing Countries, and decides that the Conference will be held in Awaza for a duration of four days, from 5 to 8 August 2025, at the highest possible level, including Heads of State and Government, on the theme “Driving progress through partnerships”;
paragraphs.2: Decides, upon the convening of the Conference, to rename the Programme of Action for Landlocked Developing Countries for the Decade 2024–2034 1 the “Awaza Programme of Action for Landlocked Developing Countries for the Decade 2024–2034”;
paragraphs.3: Strongly encourages Governments, intergovernmental and non‑governmental organizations, major groups and other donors to contribute in a timely manner to the trust fund in support of activities undertaken by the Office of the High Representative for the Least Developed Countries, Landlocked Developing Countries and Small Island Developing States to support the preparations for the Conference and the participation of landlocked developing countries in the Conference.
